panels.description: The total number of jobs in the system queued up to be executed. Lower is better.
panels.title: Sidekiq Aggregated Queue Length

panels.description: The number of jobs queued up to be executed. Lower is better
panels.title: Sidekiq Queue Lengths per Queue

panels.description: The amount of time a job has to wait before it starts being executed. Lower is better.
panels.title: Sidekiq Queuing Latency per Job

panels.description: The sum of job execution times
panels.title: Sidekiq Total Execution Time

panels.description: The sum of job execution times
panels.title: Sidekiq Total Execution Time Per Priority

panels.description: The total number of jobs being completed
panels.title: Sidekiq Aggregated Throughput

panels.description: The total number of jobs being completed per priority
panels.title: Sidekiq Throughput per Priority

panels.description: The total number of jobs being completed per priority
panels.title: Sidekiq Throughput per Job

panels.description: The total number of jobs being executed at a single moment
panels.title: Sidekiq Aggregated Inflight Operations

panels.description: The total number of jobs being executed at a single moment, for each queue
panels.title: Sidekiq Inflight Operations by Queue

panels.description: The median duration, once a job starts executing, that it runs for, by priority. Lower is better.
panels.title: Sidekiq Estimated Median Job Latency per priority

panels.description: The 95th percentile duration, once a job starts executing, that it runs for, by priority. Lower is better.
panels.title: Sidekiq Estimated p95 Job Latency per priority

panels.description: The maximum utilization of a single core on each node. Lower is better

targets.expr:
clamp_min(clamp_max(
        avg(1 - rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{type="sidekiq", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", mode="idle"}[$__interval])) by (priority)
      ,1),0)

panels.title: Node Average CPU Utilization per Priority

panels.description: The maximum utilization of a single core on each node. Lower is better

targets.expr:
clamp_min(clamp_max(
        max(1 - rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{type="sidekiq", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", mode="idle"}[$__interval])) by (priority)
      ,1),0)

panels.title: Node Maximum Single Core Utilization per Priority

panels.description: Memory utilization. Lower is better.
panels.title: Maximum Memory Utilization per Priority

panels.description: 95th percentile Latency. Lower is better
panels.title: p95 Latency Estimate

panels.description: Seconds of Rails processing, per second
panels.title: Rails Total Time

panels.description: Time spend waiting for a rails worker
panels.title: Rails Queue Time

panels.description: Total seconds spent doing SQL processing, per second
panels.title: Total SQL Time

panels.description: Cache Operations per Second
panels.title: Cache Operations

panels.description: The number of times this process restarted in a given period, including children workers. Restarts are associated with poor client experience, so lower is better.
panels.title: gitlab-rails Process restarts

panels.description:
This graph shows the average number of secondary database connections
        per process. A value of zero indicates that the secondary replicas are unreachable.
panels.title: Database load balancer: average secondary connections per client

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.
panels.title: Latency: Apdex

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions within a minute period. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better
panels.title: Error Ratios

panels.description: Availability measures the ratio of component processes in the service that are currently healthy and able to handle requests. The closer to 100% the better.
panels.title: Component Availability

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.

targets.expr:
avg(
          clamp_min(
            gitlab_service_ops:rate:prediction{environment="$environment", type="sidekiq", stage="$stage"} -
            2 * gitlab_service_ops:rate:stddev_over_time_1w{environment="$environment", type="sidekiq", stage="$stage"},
            0
          )
        )

avg(
          clamp_min(
            gitlab_service_ops:rate:prediction{environment="$environment", type="sidekiq", stage=""} -
            2 * gitlab_service_ops:rate:stddev_over_time_1w{environment="$environment", type="sidekiq", stage=""},
            0
          )
        )

panels.title: RPS - Service Requests per Second

panels.description: Saturation is a measure of what ratio of a finite resource is currently being utilized. Lower is better.
panels.title: Saturation

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.
panels.title: Component Latency: Apdex

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better
panels.title: Component Error Rates - modified scale: (1 + n) log10

panels.description: Availability measures the ratio of component processes in the service that are currently healthy and able to handle requests. The closer to 100% the better.
panels.title: Component Availability

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: Component RPS - Requests per Second

panels.description: Saturation is a measure of what ratio of a finite resource is currently being utilized. Lower is better.
panels.title: Saturation

panels.description: The amount of non-idle time consumed by nodes for this service
panels.title: Node CPU

panels.description: The maximum utilization of a single core on each node. Lower is better

targets.expr:
clamp_min(clamp_max(
          max(1 - rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{type="sidekiq", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", mode="idle"}[$__interval])) by (fqdn)
        ,1),0)

panels.title: Node Maximum Single Core Utilization

panels.description: Network utilization for nodes for this service

panels.description: Memory utilization. Lower is better.
panels.title: Memory Utilization

panels.title: Disk Read IOPs

panels.description: Disk Read throughput datarate. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Read Throughput

panels.description: Resource Saturation predictions for 14d from now. Lower is better.
panels.title: 14d Saturation Forecast (likely worst-case)

panels.description: Resource saturation levels for saturation components for this service. Lower is better.

panels.description: Percentage of time that resource is within capacity SLOs. Higher is better.
panels.title: Long-term Resource Saturation - Rolling 1w average trend
